thread.title: Arsenal transfer news: Marseille line up shock move for Olivier Giroud | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal transfer news: Marseille line up shock move for Olivier Giroud | Metro News

author: Louis Sealey For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal transfer news: Marseille line up shock move for Olivier Giroud | Metro News
text:
Marseille line up shock move for Arsenal striker Olivier Giroud gossip Louis Sealey for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 8:27 am Striker Olivier Giroud has scored 11 goals for Arsenal this season (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal striker Olivier Giroud has been identified as a potential transfer target by French club Marseille, according to reports. 
The 30-year-old has started just six Premier League games this season after losing his starting place to the impressive Alexis Sanchez at the start of the campaign. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Giroud has continued to show his importance to the Gunners, however, scoring 11 goals in all competitions despite predominantly featuring from the bench. 
The France international scored five goals in five games at the start of 2017 – including a memorable ‘scorpion kick’ at the Emirates Stadium against Crystal Palace. 
Goal France say Marseille hope to take Giroud back to his homeland and are willing to splash the cash this summer to secure key targets. 
The Ligue 1 outfit are understood to be hoping to bolster their attacking options and view Giroud as an ideal target. Arsenal fixtures 
Sutton – FA Cup (A) – Mon 20 Feb Liverpool (A) – Sat 4 Mar Bayern Munich – Champions League (H) – Tue 7 Mar Leicester (H) – Sat 11 Mar West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar Manchester City (H) – Sat 1 Apr West Ham (H) – Tue 4 Apr Crystal Palace (A) – Sat 8 Apr Gunners boss Arsene Wenger signed Giroud in 2012 (Picture: Getty)
